Title: Senior Data Analyst, Economics
Description:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the worldâ€™s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweekâ€™s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

Chainlink Labs is pioneering the worldâ€™s first fully sustainable and decentralized oracle network, and the Economics team is searching for a Senior Analyst to play a critical role in building it. This role will sit at the intersection of blockchain technology, financial innovation, and economic systems, and shape the future of decentralized economics.

As a Senior Analyst, you will combine economics, data science, and blockchain expertise to shape incentives, optimize network design, and influence the decision-making of our Economics and Executive Leadership teams. You will design, analyze, and operationalize economic models for production applications. You will collaborate across departments to bring innovative solutions from concept to production, ensuring economic soundness and scalability throughout.

This is a high-impact role, offering visibility and influence as you contribute to the development of the Chainlink network. If youâ€™re a meticulous, creative, and motivated individual ready to solve complex economic problems through data-driven decisions in the rapidly evolving world of Web3, this is the role for you.

Your Impact


You'll serve two primary functions: (1) designing and performing analyses that help the Economics and Executive Leadership teams make informed, data-driven decisions, and (2) building and maintaining systems for the parameterization of production applications.
You'll work on a wide array of blockchain economics projects, analyses, and systems, including:
Designing novel mechanisms and incentive schemes
Building models and simulations to evaluate investment opportunities
Designing and parameterizing trading systems
Optimizing parameters for production applications
Contributing to the design of Economics programs and applications
You'll optimize network incentives and systems by engaging directly with the Economics, Product, Engineering, Research, and Data Science teams to understand network dynamics at the deepest level.
You'll operationalize processes and analytics systems, and coordinate cross-functionally to implement them.
This is both a highly technical and highly social role. You will have high visibility and a large impact on how Chainlink builds the worldâ€™s first fully sustainable decentralized oracle network.

Requirements


5+ years experience in a quantitative role, particularly trading or quant research
A deep understanding of financial and crypto markets and incentives
Extensive financial modeling background, including data engineering and model automation
Strong SQL and Python skills are mandatory
Experience solving economic problems through statistical/econometric analyses
Substantial data analysis and/or data science experience
Meticulous attention to detail.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong Economics and/or Finance background through Masters-level academics and/or multiple years of industry experience.
Strong organizational and coordination skills necessary to productionize/operationalize processes and applications.
Preferably smart contract programming experience (Rust, Go, Solidity), but familiarity with smart contract code and dApp architecture at a minimum
Published research with an economics or crypto focus (e.g., papers on MEV or PBS, staking and slashing dynamics, node compensation, tokenomics, etc.)


All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, ERP and EDI
Description:
SureWerx is a leadingmanufacturerof innovative safety, tool and equipment products and solutions.Since 1957,we've been trusted to keep all who use our products safe in even the most challenging environments. Today, our growing family of world-leading brands serves customers and partners across the U.S., Canada and Europe.

At SureWerx, you'll have the opportunity to challenge yourself in a supportive, growth-oriented culture of industry leaders. Youâ€™ll help chart our future as we continue to expand into new products, services and markets. And weâ€™ll invest in your career development, enabling you to grow and succeed.

We are seeking the ideal candidate for the role of Business Systems Analyst for Enterprise Resource Planning and Electronic Data Interchange.A Business Systems Analyst (BSA) specializing in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) plays a critical role at SureWerx by bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. They possess strong business acumen with technical expertise and thrive in an environment that operates at pace. This is a hybrid role with two days in the office and the ideal candidate can work from any of our offices in Coquitlam, BC, Edmonton, AB or Guelph, ON.

Responsibilities


ERP System Configuration: Configure and customize ERP software to meet specific business requirements. This may involve making changes to modules, workflows, and data structures.
Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their ERP-related needs and gather detailed requirements. A deep understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions and SOPs.
Issue Resolution: Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and system defects related to the ERP system. Experience with the help desk Ticketing system JIRA or similar.
Data Analysis and Mapping: Analyze data and perform data mapping to ensure smooth data migration and integration between systems.
Electronic Data Interchange (EDI): Provide support, maintenance, and drive successful onboarding practices.
Vendor Interaction: Communicate with ERP software vendors to understand product capabilities, updates, and to resolve technical issues. Support relationships with ERP vendors.
System Testing: Develop test plans, conduct system testing, and coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure the ERP system meets business requirements and functions correctly.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, including functional specifications, system design, and process flows.
Training: Train end-users and provide support during the ERP implementation and post-implementation phases.
Change Management: Assist in managing the change process associated with ERP implementations, ensuring smooth transitions and user adoption.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and system enhancements to optimize ERP functionality.
Project plan: assists in project planning and project scope sessions to ensure compliance to the project charter and implementation plan.


Qualifications


A bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, or a related field is typically required. A master's degree or relevant certifications can be advantageous.
Proven experience (typically 2-5 years) as a Business Systems Analyst, with strong knowledge of ERP systems, such as SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar platforms, including understanding of ERP modules like Finance, Operations, WMS, Supply Chain, and Distribution.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address system issues effectively.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and vendors.
Proficiency in relevant programming languages, database management especially Unidata databases, EDI, and tools for ERP customization and configuration.
Ability to create and maintain detailed documentation for technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborative and adaptable, able to work effectively within a team and adapt to changing business needs.
Strong problem-solving skills to identify and address system issues effectively.


SureWerx is committed to fostering equal opportunities, and to providing an inclusive and respectful working environment in which all employees can thrive. We aim to attract and retain a workforce that represents and celebrates the diverse communities we so proudly serve. We therefore encourage applications from women, LGBTQ+ people, Indigenous Peoples, people of colour, persons with disabilities, and people who are neuro diverse. Please advise our HR team if any accommodations are required to support you during the recruitment process.

At SureWerx, you'll have the opportunity to challenge yourself in a supportive, growth-oriented culture of industry leaders. Youâ€™ll help chart our future as we continue to expand into new products, services and markets. And weâ€™ll invest in your career development, enabling you to grow and succeed.

We are seeking the ideal candidate for the role of Business Systems Analyst for Enterprise Resource Planning and Electronic Data Interchange.A Business Systems Analyst (BSA) specializing in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) plays a critical role at SureWerx by bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. They possess strong business acumen with technical expertise and thrive in an environment that operates at pace. This is a hybrid role with two days in the office and the ideal candidate can work from any of our offices in Coquitlam, BC, Edmonton, AB or Guelph, ON.

Responsibilities

  • ERP System Configuration: Configure and customize ERP software to meet specific business requirements. This may involve making changes to modules, workflows, and data structures.
  • Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their ERP-related needs and gather detailed requirements. A deep understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions and SOPs.
  • Issue Resolution: Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and system defects related to the ERP system. Experience with the help desk Ticketing system JIRA or similar.
  • Data Analysis and Mapping: Analyze data and perform data mapping to ensure smooth data migration and integration between systems.
  • Electronic Data Interchange (EDI): Provide support, maintenance, and drive successful onboarding practices.
  • Vendor Interaction: Communicate with ERP software vendors to understand product capabilities, updates, and to resolve technical issues. Support relationships with ERP vendors.
  • System Testing: Develop test plans, conduct system testing, and coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure the ERP system meets business requirements and functions correctly.
  • Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, including functional specifications, system design, and process flows.
  • Training: Train end-users and provide support during the ERP implementation and post-implementation phases.
  • Change Management: Assist in managing the change process associated with ERP implementations, ensuring smooth transitions and user adoption.
  • Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and system enhancements to optimize ERP functionality.
  • Project plan: assists in project planning and project scope sessions to ensure compliance to the project charter and implementation plan.

Qualifications

  • A bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, or a related field is typically required. A master's degree or relevant certifications can be advantageous.
  • Proven experience (typically 2-5 years) as a Business Systems Analyst, with strong knowledge of ERP systems, such as SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar platforms, including understanding of ERP modules like Finance, Operations, WMS, Supply Chain, and Distribution.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address system issues effectively.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and vendors.
  • Proficiency in relevant programming languages, database management especially Unidata databases, EDI, and tools for ERP customization and configuration.
  • Ability to create and maintain detailed documentation for technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Collaborative and adaptable, able to work effectively within a team and adapt to changing business needs.
  • Strong problem-solving skills to identify and address system issues effectively.

SureWerx is committed to fostering equal opportunities, and to providing an inclusive and respectful working environment in which all employees can thrive. We aim to attract and retain a workforce that represents and celebrates the diverse communities we so proudly serve. We therefore encourage applications from women, LGBTQ+ people, Indigenous Peoples, people of colour, persons with disabilities, and people who are neuro diverse. Please advise our HR team if any accommodations are required to support you during the recruitment process.

Title: Jr. Analyst, Client Services Intern (Hybrid)
Description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If youâ€™re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.

At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If youâ€™re passionate about developing your career while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.

We are currently seeking a Jr. Analyst Intern, Client Services to join our dynamic team. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology solutions while working on impactful projects. You will play a key role in driving data transformation, analytics, and internal productivity initiatives that directly influence decision-making and operational excellence.

Summer Internship: May 2025 - August 2025

Key Job Functions/Responsibilities


Design and implement internal productivity tools to enhance team effectiveness, including developing applications using programming languages like Python or JavaScript
Conduct data cleaning, transformation, and visualization projects to improve data accuracy and provide actionable insights for senior management, leveraging tools like PowerBI and ChatGPT
Analyze Client Services data to identify patterns and trends that inform service improvements or future product offerings
Assist in maintaining and creating documentation on Confluence to ensure knowledge-sharing and process standardization across teams
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand business challenges and propose data-driven solutions
Partner closely with the development team to guide and prioritize assigned development initiatives
Support the creation of training materials and user guides to drive efficiency and adoption of new tools


Basic Skill Level Requirements

Education:


Currently enrolled in a 2nd or 3rd year University Degree or College Diploma program in Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field


Technical Skills/Tools:


Proficiency in the MS Office Suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio
Proficiency in PowerBI or similar data visualization tools is an asset
Experience with SQL, Python, Java, or JavaScript; familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) is a plus
Knowledge of design principles, data modeling, process modeling, wireframes, and prototyping


Personal Skills:


Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset
Effective communication skills, including business writing, presentations, and stakeholder engagement
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build consensus, negotiate, and collaborate cross-functionally
A proactive and curious mindset with a strong desire to learn and contribute meaningfully to the team
Ability to work independently on projects, with tight deadlines, under minimal supervision Demonstrated experience in project coordination or a similar role
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work effectively in a fast-paced environment


Recruitment Process

Throughout your application process, you may be asked to connect with us virtually or in-person. Our recruiters will explain how hybrid interviews will be held throughout the recruitment process, and they will be able to answer any questions you might have.

Background Check Process

Broadridge requires employees to complete a background check that is completed by one of our service providers. We use this service to complete the following checks:


Employment verification
Education verification
Credit inquiry
Canadian criminal record check


Workplace Flexibility

We are committed to supporting flexible work arrangements, investing in technology or other resources to enable you to work from home effectively, wherever possible.

At this time this is a hybrid role, and therefore you should have a basic home office set up, high-speed internet, and the ability to work without distractions during core business hours.

Accessibility & Accommodation

Broadridge is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace ensuring that equal employment opportunities are provided to all individuals, regardless of race, colour, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, creed, age, disability, religious affiliation, or national origin or citizenship. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, please notify our recruitment team.

Broadridge associates helped us envision our Connected Workplace - a work model that allows associates around the globe, dependent upon their role responsibilities, take advantage of the benefits of both on-site and off-site work to support our clients, one another, and the communities where we live and work. Our Connected Workplace is grounded in the concept of FACS: Flexible, Accountable, Connected, and Supported, which is our commitment to our associates. FACS supports our strong culture and allows us to achieve business goals while supporting meaningful work-life integration for our associates.

We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment and committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates can only do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a companyâ€”and ultimately a communityâ€”that recognizes and celebrates diversity in all its dimensions.

Title: Research Intern - Agent Systems for AI Infrastructure
Description:
Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers, who pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

As a Research Intern at Microsoft Research Asia Vancouver, you will be at the forefront of developing and implementing cutting-edge agent systems for AI infrastructure. This position is perfect for those passionate about the future of agent systems and AI-driven design. You will work alongside a team of top-tier researchers and engineers in Vancouver, Canada, and Redmond, US, to create LLM-based agent systems that will drive the next generation of AI infrastructure, enhancing its efficiency and effectiveness.

Responsibilities

Research Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the worldâ€™s best researchers, Research Interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Research Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, Research Interns are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other Research Interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Additional Responsibilities


Development and Implementation: Design LLM-based agent systems for AI infrastructure. Implement prototypes and conduct experiments to test and validate them.
Research and Analysis: Conduct thorough research on emerging trends in agent systems for AI software and hardware infrastructure.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, software developers, and data scientists, to integrate your ideas with existing and future agent projects.
Documentation and Reporting: Prepare detailed documentation of simulations, methodologies, and findings. Present results and insights to team members and stakeholders.
Innovation and Problem-Solving: Identify challenges and bottlenecks in AI infrastructure and propose innovative solutions.


Qualifications

Required Qualifications


Currently enrolled in aâ€¯bachelor's, master's, or PhD program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Machine learning, Mathematics, or a related field.


Other Requirements


Research Interns are expected to be physically located in their managerâ€™s Microsoft worksite location for the duration of their internship.
In addition to the qualifications below, youâ€™ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position as well as a cover letter and any relevant work or research samples. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.


Preferred Qualifications


Proficient in programming languages such as C/C++ or Python.
Familiar with fundamental concepts related to LLM, prompt engineering, and LLM-based agents. Experience in AI for systems and/or systems for AI.
Passionate about addressing real-world large-scale infrastructure problems using AI models. Experience with AI infrastructure or LLM would be a plus.
Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills and communication skills, both written and verbal.


Intern - MSR- The typical base pay range for this role across Canada is CAD $8,700 - CAD $9,700 per month.

Find Additional Pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/v2/global/en/canada-pay-information.html

Microsoft accepts applications and processes offers for these roles on an ongoing basis.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Technical Data Analyst, Blockchain
Description:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the worldâ€™s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweekâ€™s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Engineer to drive the development of Chainlinkâ€™s public-facing dashboard. This dashboard will serve as a key resource for the Web3 community, showcasing metrics that highlight the performance, adoption, and impact of the Chainlink Network. The ideal candidate will have strong technical expertise in data engineering combined with a deep understanding of the blockchain and Web3 space.

In this role, you will take ownership of defining the metrics to be displayed, building the logic to calculate these metrics, and creating robust data pipelines to ensure their delivery. Youâ€™ll be responsible for the accuracy, quality, and timeliness of these metrics, while also contributing insights into how these metrics should reflect the unique aspects of the blockchain ecosystem.

Your Impact


Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize metrics for the dashboard.
Build logic to calculate metrics such as transaction volume, total value secured, and staking activity.
Design and maintain ETL pipelines to process blockchain data and ensure seamless delivery to the dashboard.
Ensure high data quality and timeliness through monitoring, validation, and debugging processes.
Provide insights into blockchain-specific metrics, differentiating between concepts such as transaction volume vs. locked value and understanding diverse protocol types (e.g., perpetuals vs. lending protocols).
Act as a subject matter expert in blockchain data, helping teams interpret the difference between decentralized applications (Dapps) and smart contracts. Partnering with GTM and Marketing which makes understanding metrics and blockchain is important.


Requirements


Proven experience in data engineering, with expertise in ETL processes, cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS), and tools like Apache Airflow, SQL, and Python.
Strong knowledge of blockchain fundamentals, including smart contracts, decentralized applications, and protocol types.
Familiarity with Web3 metrics, such as transaction volume, TVL (Total Value Locked), staking, and protocol usage data.
Excellent ability to collaborate across cross-functional teams, including data science, product, and engineering.
Passion for Web3, blockchain, and decentralized ecosystems.


Join our team to craft the data backbone of Chainlinkâ€™s public narrative, providing the Web3 community with the insights they need to understand and trust the value of decentralized systems!

All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
